rewards.name: Enemy Killed
rewards.description: Awarded for enemy KIA. Don't celebrate too soon; their squad lead is probably marking your position right now.

rewards.name: Kill Assist
rewards.description: Awarded for damaging an enemy who is later finished off by a teammate. Good teamwork or just barely missing the final shot? You decide.

rewards.name: Enemy Suppressed
rewards.description: You dumped rounds in the enemy’s general direction and kept their heads down. Whether you hit them or not is another story, but hey, fire superiority matters.

rewards.name: Team Assist
rewards.description: Given for supporting teammates in actions that lead to successful engagements, such as providing suppressive fire or spotting enemies.

rewards.name: Objective Offensive
rewards.description: Awarded for aggressively holding W toward the point while bullets fly past your head. Remember, aggression wins wars.

rewards.name: Objective Defensive
rewards.description: Awarded for holding the line against enemy advances within the objective. Just don't stand in the open too long.

rewards.name: Revived On The Objective
rewards.description: Awarded for reviving a teammate within the objective area, ensuring the fight continues. Medics truly hold the line.

rewards.name: Team Kill
rewards.description: Awarded for poor IFF but great accuracy.

rewards.name: Vehicle Destroyed
rewards.description: Awarded for eliminating an enemy vehicle. Whether it’s a lone technical or a full APC, you’ve done your team a great service.

rewards.name: Vehicle Assist
rewards.description: Awarded for assisting in the destruction of an enemy vehicle. Even a well-placed LAT shot can make all the difference.

rewards.name: Kill Streak
rewards.description: Awarded for chaining multiple kills without dying. The higher the streak, the bigger the payout. Try not to let it get to your head.

rewards.name: Revive
rewards.description: Granted for reviving teammates, enhancing team sustainability.

rewards.name: Healing
rewards.description: Awarded for providing medical assistance to teammates, ensuring they remain combat-effective.

rewards.name: Resupply
rewards.description: Given for supplying teammates with ammunition or equipment, supporting their operational capabilities.

rewards.name: Repair
rewards.description: Awarded for repairing friendly vehicles or equipment, maintaining team assets.

rewards.name: Team Balance Compensation
rewards.description: Awarded for switching to the underpopulated team. Congrats on taking one for the team, literally. But hey, sometimes the underdog wins, and when they do, it’s even sweeter.

rewards.name: End of Game Bonus
rewards.description: Awarded based on total performance at the end of a match. The best performers walk away with the biggest rewards.

rewards.name: Tactical Paradrop
rewards.description: Earned by successfully deploying into strategic locations via paradrop, facilitating tactical advantages.

rewards.name: Long Distance Kill
rewards.description: Awarded for eliminating an enemy from a significant distance, showcasing marksmanship skills.

rewards.name: Teammate Transported
rewards.description: Awarded for safely delivering teammates to a crucial location. Squad leaders will appreciate this, and so will your xp bar.

rewards.name: The Sphere
rewards.description: Awarded for witnessing or being directly involved in the strange, cursed, otherworldly phenomena known as 'The Sphere.' We don’t know how or why it happens, but we salute your courage in its presence.

rewards.name: Infantry Combat Overhaul
rewards.description: Awarded for reaching 100% ICO status effects. Congratulations, you've ascended to a new level of pain and suffering. Your vision is blurred, your arms flail like wet spaghetti, and every bullet whizzing past feels like a personal insult.

rewards.name: Bad Nade
rewards.description: Awarded for dying to you own grenade. That was embarrassing.

rewards.name: Priority Offensive
rewards.description: Awarded for attacking the priority zone! Its almost yours keep fighting!

rewards.name: Priority Defensive
rewards.description: Awarded for holding the priority zone. Dont give them an inch

rewards.name: MSV Destroyed
rewards.description: Awarded for destroying an enemy spawn vehicle.

rewards.name: King Of The Hill
rewards.description: Awarded for winning the match

rewards.name: Stoned
rewards.description: Awarded for hitting an enemy player with a rock.

rewards.name: Beer Fund
rewards.description: Awarded for being a brokie and need the money.

rewards.name: Skill Issue
rewards.description: Get your shit together!

rewards.name: Enemy Stabbed
rewards.description: Awarded for stabbing an enemy player. Congratulations, you won the melee lottery in a game that barely acknowledges knives exist.

rewards.name: Razor Wire
rewards.description: Rewarded for getting tangled in Razor Wire. Watch your step, idiot!

rewards.name: Friendly MSV Destroyed
rewards.description: Why would you do this???

rewards.name: Main Camping
rewards.description: Dont do that again.

rewards.name: Bot Killed
rewards.description: Congrats, you fragged the digital equivalent of a wet cardboard box. The hill is safer, somehow.

rewards.name: Friendly Bot Killed
rewards.description: Your aim's deadly... to morale. Try pointing the gun at the enemy next time, maybe?

rewards.name: Razor Wire
rewards.description: Awarded for getting wraped in barbed wire. Watch your step!!!

primary.description: A Russian bolt-action rifle chambered in 7.62x54mmR, first introduced in the late 19th century. Known for its rugged construction and long-range effectiveness, it has seen action in numerous conflicts and remains a popular surplus firearm among collectors and marksmen.
A Soviet-era semi-automatic carbine chambered in 7.62x39mm. Known for its rugged design and widespread use across various conflicts.

A Russian pump-action shotgun chambered in 23×75mmR, originally designed for riot control but adapted for military and special forces use. With its powerful cartridges, it can breach doors, or deliver extreme stopping power in combat scenarios.
A British bullpup assault rifle, standard issue for the British Army. Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO, it offers reliability and accuracy in combat.
An upgraded variant of the M16, chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. Features burst fire and improved durability, widely used by the U.S. military.
A Soviet submachine gun chambered in 7.62x25mm Tokarev, featuring a high rate of fire and a distinctive drum magazine. Widely used in World War II, it became an iconic weapon of the Eastern Front.
A refined, lighter AK variant chambered in 5.45x39mm. Designed for improved accuracy and lower recoil, it's the standard rifle of Russian forces.

A German general-purpose machine gun chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, known for its high rate of fire and battlefield dominance. Based on the MG42, it remains in service worldwide due to its reliability, sustained fire capability, and effectiveness in both mounted and infantry roles.
Magazine Capacity: 30+1/Caliber: 5.56x45mm NATO/Rate of Fire: 750 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Full Auto/Zeroing: 100m
Magazine Capacity: 30+1/Caliber: 5.45x39mm/Rate of Fire: 650 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Auto

primary.name: M249
primary.description: A belt-fed 5.56x45mm light machine gun, providing sustained firepower for squad support. Reliable and deadly in suppressing enemies.
The X95 is an bullpup assault rifle chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO with a rate of fire of 750 RPM.

A German submachine gun chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum, renowned for its accuracy, reliability, and widespread use among military and law enforcement units worldwide. Its modular design allows for various configurations to suit different operational needs.

A Belgian battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, often referred to as 'The Right Arm of the Free World'. Known for its reliability, accuracy, and adaptability, it was widely adopted by NATO and allied forces during the Cold War.

A German battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, featuring a collapsible stock for improved mobility. Known for its stopping power and durability, it has seen extensive use in military forces worldwide.

A German battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, featuring a collapsible stock for improved mobility. Known for its stopping power and durability, it has seen extensive use in military forces worldwide.

A modernized Russian light machine gun chambered in 5.45x39mm, designed for sustained fire with improved accuracy and reduced recoil. It features a polymer stock and a longer barrel, making it an effective squad support weapon.

The PP-19 Vityaz (also known as the PP-19-01 Vityaz-SN) is a 9x19mm Parabellum submachine gun developed in 2004 by Russian small arms manufacturer Izhmash. It is based on the AK-74 and offers a high degree of parts commonality with the AK-74. The gun is directly developed from the PP-19 Bizon. Vityaz is Russian for brave warrior or knight.
Magazine Capacity: 30+1/Caliber: 5.56x45mm NATO/Rate of Fire: 750 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Full Auto/Zeroing: 100m-600m
A modernized version of the AK-47, the AKM retains the legendary reliability and 7.62x39mm firepower, making it a battlefield staple worldwide.

A Soviet-era belt-fed light machine gun chambered in 7.62x39mm, designed for continuous fire in extended engagements. Known for its simplicity and durability, it served as a predecessor to later squad automatic weapons like the RPK.
Add C7A2 Test
A heavy-hitting 7.62x51mm belt-fed machine gun, known for its stopping power and battlefield dominance as a squad support weapon.
A compact and versatile 5.56x45mm carbine, standard for U.S. troops. Offers full auto or burst fire and excels in close-quarters and mid-range combat.

A Turkish submachine gun chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum, designed for close-quarters combat and law enforcement use. Featuring a compact frame, modern ergonomics, and compatibility with Glock magazines, it offers reliability and versatility in urban engagements.
The MPX is a gas-operated submachine gun designed and manufactured by SIG Sauer, and is primarily chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum.

A pump-action shotgun chambered in 12-gauge, widely used by military, law enforcement, and civilian shooters. Known for its reliability and versatility, it serves in both combat and sporting applications.
Magazine Capacity: 20+1/Caliber: 7.62x51mm NATO/Rate of Fire: 630 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Full-Auto
Add M14 Test

A compact variant of the M4, featuring a shortened barrel and collapsible stock for enhanced maneuverability in tight spaces. Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO, it is favored by military contractors and special forces for its versatility, making it ideal for urban combat, vehicle operations, and close-quarters engagements.
A warped take on the M4 carbine, altered for unconventional warfare. Compact, rapid-firing, and strangely effective in the hands of a skilled operator.
A highly customized AK101.
A semi-automatic designated marksman rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. Used by U.S. forces for precision fire at medium to long ranges.

A compact variant of the M4, featuring a shortened barrel and collapsible stock for enhanced maneuverability in tight spaces. Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO, it is favored by military contractors and special forces for its versatility, making it ideal for urban combat, vehicle operations, and close-quarters engagements.
A specialized Russian suppressed assault rifle chambered in 9x39mm. Designed for stealth operations, it excels in close to mid-range engagements.

A Russian bolt-action sniper rifle chambered in 7.62x54mmR, designed for precision long-range engagements. Equipped with a heavy barrel, adjustable stock, and suppressor compatibility, it is favored by military and special forces snipers for its accuracy and reliability.
A twisted variant of the classic M16, modified for chaotic engagements. Fires 5.56x45mm NATO with unpredictable precision—deadly yet unorthodox.

A semi-automatic shotgun chambered in 12-gauge, designed for military and law enforcement use. Featuring a gas-operated system, it offers rapid follow-up shots and exceptional durability in harsh conditions.
Magazine Capacity: 5/Caliber: .338 Lapua Magnum/Fire Mode: Bolt-Action
I got a rock.

secondary.description: A Soviet semi-automatic pistol chambered in 7.62x25mm Tokarev. Developed in the 1930s, it features a rugged design with high penetration capability, making it a favored sidearm in World War II and beyond.

A Soviet-designed semi-automatic pistol chambered in 9x18mm Makarov. Known for its simplicity, reliability, and compact design, it served as the standard sidearm for Soviet and Eastern Bloc forces for decades.

A classic semi-automatic pistol chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. Designed by John Browning, it features a high-capacity magazine and exceptional ergonomics, making it a widely used military sidearm throughout the 20th century.

A Russian military pistol chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. Designed as a modern replacement for the Makarov, it offers increased magazine capacity and improved ergonomics while maintaining rugged durability.

n Austrian polymer-framed, striker-fired pistol available in multiple calibers, with 9x19mm being the most common. Renowned for its reliability, simplicity, and ease of maintenance, it is widely used by military, law enforcement, and civilian shooters worldwide.

An upgraded version of the M9, chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum, featuring an accessory rail, improved grip texture, and enhanced durability. It served as the U.S. military's standard-issue sidearm before being replaced by the M17.

The U.S. military’s current standard-issue sidearm, chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. Based on the SIG P320 platform, it features modular grip options, an integrated safety system, and an optics-ready slide for modern tactical applications.

A compact variant of the Remington 870 pump-action shotgun, featuring a shortened barrel and stock for increased maneuverability in close-quarters combat. Chambered in 12-gauge, it delivers devastating stopping power at short range but sacrifices accuracy and capacity.

A compact Czechoslovakian submachine gun chambered in .32 ACP (7.65x17mm). Designed for military and law enforcement, it features a folding wire stock and a high rate of fire, making it effective for close-quarters combat and concealed carry.

special.description: A grenade that detonates on impact.
A powerful, stable explosive widely used for demolition and military applications. Known for its high explosive yield and reliability, it remains a standard in warfare and construction.

A plastic explosive known for its stability, moldability, and high detonation power. Used in military and demolition operations, it requires a detonator to activate, making it highly controlled and versatile.
A Soviet handheld anti-tank grenade with a shaped charge warhead. Designed for use against armored vehicles, it requires the user to throw it at an angle for maximum penetration upon impact.
WPMC Single Fire Grenade Launcher chambered in 40mm grenades. 6 Rounds
A shoulder fired rocket launcher, popular in conflicts worldwide.
A  disposable anti-tank rocket-propelled grenade.

The M3 Multi-Role Anti-Armor Anti-Personnel Weapon System (MAAWS), commonly known as the Carl Gustaf, is a 84mm recoilless rifle used by the U.S. military, particularly by Special Operations Command units
Mk 153 Shoulder-Launched Multipurpose Assault Weapon (SMAW) is a shoulder-fired rocket launcher primarily used as a portable assault weapon, or tank buster.
AT4 is a Swedish 84 mm unguided, man-portable, disposable, shoulder-fired recoilless anti-tank weapon.
portable one-shot 66 mm (2.6 in) unguided anti-tank weapon.
The DZJ-08 is a portable, disposable, unguided, shoulder-launched, multipurpose recoilless weapon.
A Russian handheld anti-tank rocket launcher.
Soviet reusable rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) launcher.
84 mm recoilless rifle.
The missile uses a soft-launch system and is guided by predicted line of sight (PLOS).
The Type 98 (PF-98) is a 120mm unguided anti-tank rocket system.
WPMC Single Fire Grenade Launcher chambered in 40mm grenades. 14 Rounds
WPMC Single Fire Grenade Launcher chambered in 40mm grenades. 14 Rounds
A South African-designed multi-shot grenade launcher chambered for 40mm grenades. With a six-round rotating cylinder, it provides rapid indirect fire capability for military and special forces.
A South African-designed multi-shot grenade launcher chambered for 40mm grenades. With a six-round rotating cylinder, it provides rapid indirect fire capability for military and special forces.

An Improvised Explosive Device, typically crafted from available materials for asymmetric warfare. Used in guerrilla tactics and insurgency operations, it can range from crude roadside bombs to sophisticated remote-detonated explosives.
A flashbang
A flashbang

deployables.description: Slows down and damages enemies. Great for choke points slowing down enemy movement
Solid cover to protect from incoming fire
Provides a peronal concealed firing position
Provides access to elevated positions
Provides solid cover and is difficult to climb over. Lined with barbed wire.
Provides solid cover and is difficult to climb over. Lined with barbed wire.
Provides solid cover and is difficult to climb over. Lined with barbed wire.
Provides solid cover and is difficult to climb over. Lined with barbed wire.

vehicles.name: ATV
vehicles.description: An ATV with 2 seats. A cheap method of transportation.

vehicles.name: RHIB_M2
vehicles.description: A boat with a mounted 50 cal

vehicles.name: Motorcycle
vehicles.description: A Motorcycle with 2 seats. A cheap method of transportation.

vehicles.name: Loach_Scout
vehicles.description: Small helicopter, fast but can be easily shot down.

vehicles.name: CPV
vehicles.description: An armored SUV, favored by private militaries

vehicles.name: Technical_Dshk
vehicles.description: A rusty pickup with a 50 cal mounted in the bed.

vehicles.name: Tigr
vehicles.description: A well armored squad transport vehicle. Equipped with an open-top 50cal

vehicles.name: CPV_M134
vehicles.description: an armored SUV with an open top mini gun

vehicles.name: MATV
vehicles.description: A well armored squad transport vehicle. Equipped with an open-top 50cal

vehicles.name: MATV_MK19
vehicles.description: a well armored squad transport vehicle. Equpped with an open-top Mk19 grenade launcher

vehicles.name: Technical_SpG9
vehicles.description: A rusty pickup with a rocket launcher moutned in the bed

vehicles.name: BMP Techie
vehicles.description: An abomination of cracked welds. To be feared on the battlefield.

perks.name: Engineer
perks.description: Gives you an Engineer Shovel

perks.name: Ammo
perks.description: Gives you a deployable ammo bag

perks.name: Anti-Flash Goggles
perks.description: Provides you with goggles that resist flashbangs.

perks.name: Crewman
perks.description: Gives you a repair kit for repairing friendly vehicles to a working condition. This additionally unlocks compact

perks.name: Explosives
perks.description: Grants access to Explosives

perks.name: Marksman
perks.description: Grants access to sniper rifles, DMRs, long range scopes.

perks.name: Launcher
perks.description: Grants access to Anti-Tank, Anti-Air and Anti-Personnel launchers.

perks.name: Medic
perks.description: Gives you a Medical Kit for healing yourself and teammates, as well as extra Bandages.

perks.name: Overkill
perks.description: Allows you to purchase primary items in the secondary store.

perks.name: Grenadier
perks.description: Grants access to underbarrel grenade launcher variants.

perks.name: Shift-W
perks.description: Increases stamina regeneration.

perks.name: Machinegunner
perks.description: Grants access to machineguns and higher capacity magazines.

perks.name: Money
perks.description: Increases money rewards by 10% and reduces price when buying your last loadout by 50%

perks.name: Silencer
perks.description: Grants access to Silenced weapons

perks.name: SPHERE
perks.description: WIP! THE SPHERE IS REAL. PRAISE SPHERE

perks.name: SPHERE
perks.description: WIP! THE SPHERE IS REAL. PRAISE SPHERE

primary.description: A Russian bolt-action rifle chambered in 7.62x54mmR, first introduced in the late 19th century. Known for its rugged construction and long-range effectiveness, it has seen action in numerous conflicts and remains a popular surplus firearm among collectors and marksmen.
A Soviet-era semi-automatic carbine chambered in 7.62x39mm. Known for its rugged design and widespread use across various conflicts.

A Russian pump-action shotgun chambered in 23×75mmR, originally designed for riot control but adapted for military and special forces use. With its powerful cartridges, it can breach doors, or deliver extreme stopping power in combat scenarios.
A British bullpup assault rifle, standard issue for the British Army. Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO, it offers reliability and accuracy in combat.
An upgraded variant of the M16, chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. Features burst fire and improved durability, widely used by the U.S. military.
A Soviet submachine gun chambered in 7.62x25mm Tokarev, featuring a high rate of fire and a distinctive drum magazine. Widely used in World War II, it became an iconic weapon of the Eastern Front.
A refined, lighter AK variant chambered in 5.45x39mm. Designed for improved accuracy and lower recoil, it's the standard rifle of Russian forces.

A German general-purpose machine gun chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, known for its high rate of fire and battlefield dominance. Based on the MG42, it remains in service worldwide due to its reliability, sustained fire capability, and effectiveness in both mounted and infantry roles.
Magazine Capacity: 30+1/Caliber: 5.56x45mm NATO/Rate of Fire: 750 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Full Auto/Zeroing: 100m
Magazine Capacity: 30+1/Caliber: 5.45x39mm/Rate of Fire: 650 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Auto

primary.name: M249
primary.description: A belt-fed 5.56x45mm light machine gun, providing sustained firepower for squad support. Reliable and deadly in suppressing enemies.
The X95 is an bullpup assault rifle chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO with a rate of fire of 750 RPM.

A German submachine gun chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum, renowned for its accuracy, reliability, and widespread use among military and law enforcement units worldwide. Its modular design allows for various configurations to suit different operational needs.

A Belgian battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, often referred to as 'The Right Arm of the Free World'. Known for its reliability, accuracy, and adaptability, it was widely adopted by NATO and allied forces during the Cold War.

A German battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, featuring a collapsible stock for improved mobility. Known for its stopping power and durability, it has seen extensive use in military forces worldwide.

A German battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, featuring a collapsible stock for improved mobility. Known for its stopping power and durability, it has seen extensive use in military forces worldwide.

A modernized Russian light machine gun chambered in 5.45x39mm, designed for sustained fire with improved accuracy and reduced recoil. It features a polymer stock and a longer barrel, making it an effective squad support weapon.

The PP-19 Vityaz (also known as the PP-19-01 Vityaz-SN) is a 9x19mm Parabellum submachine gun developed in 2004 by Russian small arms manufacturer Izhmash. It is based on the AK-74 and offers a high degree of parts commonality with the AK-74. The gun is directly developed from the PP-19 Bizon. Vityaz is Russian for brave warrior or knight.
Magazine Capacity: 30+1/Caliber: 5.56x45mm NATO/Rate of Fire: 750 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Full Auto/Zeroing: 100m-600m
A modernized version of the AK-47, the AKM retains the legendary reliability and 7.62x39mm firepower, making it a battlefield staple worldwide.

A Soviet-era belt-fed light machine gun chambered in 7.62x39mm, designed for continuous fire in extended engagements. Known for its simplicity and durability, it served as a predecessor to later squad automatic weapons like the RPK.
Add C7A2 Test
A heavy-hitting 7.62x51mm belt-fed machine gun, known for its stopping power and battlefield dominance as a squad support weapon.
A compact and versatile 5.56x45mm carbine, standard for U.S. troops. Offers full auto or burst fire and excels in close-quarters and mid-range combat.

A Turkish submachine gun chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum, designed for close-quarters combat and law enforcement use. Featuring a compact frame, modern ergonomics, and compatibility with Glock magazines, it offers reliability and versatility in urban engagements.
The MPX is a gas-operated submachine gun designed and manufactured by SIG Sauer, and is primarily chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum.

A pump-action shotgun chambered in 12-gauge, widely used by military, law enforcement, and civilian shooters. Known for its reliability and versatility, it serves in both combat and sporting applications.
Magazine Capacity: 20+1/Caliber: 7.62x51mm NATO/Rate of Fire: 630 RPM/Fire Mode: Semi, Full-Auto
Add M14 Test

A compact variant of the M4, featuring a shortened barrel and collapsible stock for enhanced maneuverability in tight spaces. Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO, it is favored by military contractors and special forces for its versatility, making it ideal for urban combat, vehicle operations, and close-quarters engagements.
A warped take on the M4 carbine, altered for unconventional warfare. Compact, rapid-firing, and strangely effective in the hands of a skilled operator.
A highly customized AK101.
A semi-automatic designated marksman rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. Used by U.S. forces for precision fire at medium to long ranges.

A compact variant of the M4, featuring a shortened barrel and collapsible stock for enhanced maneuverability in tight spaces. Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO, it is favored by military contractors and special forces for its versatility, making it ideal for urban combat, vehicle operations, and close-quarters engagements.
A specialized Russian suppressed assault rifle chambered in 9x39mm. Designed for stealth operations, it excels in close to mid-range engagements.

A Russian bolt-action sniper rifle chambered in 7.62x54mmR, designed for precision long-range engagements. Equipped with a heavy barrel, adjustable stock, and suppressor compatibility, it is favored by military and special forces snipers for its accuracy and reliability.
A twisted variant of the classic M16, modified for chaotic engagements. Fires 5.56x45mm NATO with unpredictable precision—deadly yet unorthodox.

A semi-automatic shotgun chambered in 12-gauge, designed for military and law enforcement use. Featuring a gas-operated system, it offers rapid follow-up shots and exceptional durability in harsh conditions.
Magazine Capacity: 5/Caliber: .338 Lapua Magnum/Fire Mode: Bolt-Action
I got a rock.

secondary.description: A Soviet semi-automatic pistol chambered in 7.62x25mm Tokarev. Developed in the 1930s, it features a rugged design with high penetration capability, making it a favored sidearm in World War II and beyond.

A Soviet-designed semi-automatic pistol chambered in 9x18mm Makarov. Known for its simplicity, reliability, and compact design, it served as the standard sidearm for Soviet and Eastern Bloc forces for decades.

A classic semi-automatic pistol chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. Designed by John Browning, it features a high-capacity magazine and exceptional ergonomics, making it a widely used military sidearm throughout the 20th century.

A Russian military pistol chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. Designed as a modern replacement for the Makarov, it offers increased magazine capacity and improved ergonomics while maintaining rugged durability.

n Austrian polymer-framed, striker-fired pistol available in multiple calibers, with 9x19mm being the most common. Renowned for its reliability, simplicity, and ease of maintenance, it is widely used by military, law enforcement, and civilian shooters worldwide.

An upgraded version of the M9, chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum, featuring an accessory rail, improved grip texture, and enhanced durability. It served as the U.S. military's standard-issue sidearm before being replaced by the M17.

The U.S. military’s current standard-issue sidearm, chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. Based on the SIG P320 platform, it features modular grip options, an integrated safety system, and an optics-ready slide for modern tactical applications.

A compact variant of the Remington 870 pump-action shotgun, featuring a shortened barrel and stock for increased maneuverability in close-quarters combat. Chambered in 12-gauge, it delivers devastating stopping power at short range but sacrifices accuracy and capacity.

A compact Czechoslovakian submachine gun chambered in .32 ACP (7.65x17mm). Designed for military and law enforcement, it features a folding wire stock and a high rate of fire, making it effective for close-quarters combat and concealed carry.

special.description: A grenade that detonates on impact.
A powerful, stable explosive widely used for demolition and military applications. Known for its high explosive yield and reliability, it remains a standard in warfare and construction.

A plastic explosive known for its stability, moldability, and high detonation power. Used in military and demolition operations, it requires a detonator to activate, making it highly controlled and versatile.
A Soviet handheld anti-tank grenade with a shaped charge warhead. Designed for use against armored vehicles, it requires the user to throw it at an angle for maximum penetration upon impact.
WPMC Single Fire Grenade Launcher chambered in 40mm grenades. 6 Rounds
A shoulder fired rocket launcher, popular in conflicts worldwide.
A  disposable anti-tank rocket-propelled grenade.

The M3 Multi-Role Anti-Armor Anti-Personnel Weapon System (MAAWS), commonly known as the Carl Gustaf, is a 84mm recoilless rifle used by the U.S. military, particularly by Special Operations Command units
Mk 153 Shoulder-Launched Multipurpose Assault Weapon (SMAW) is a shoulder-fired rocket launcher primarily used as a portable assault weapon, or tank buster.
AT4 is a Swedish 84 mm unguided, man-portable, disposable, shoulder-fired recoilless anti-tank weapon.
portable one-shot 66 mm (2.6 in) unguided anti-tank weapon.
The DZJ-08 is a portable, disposable, unguided, shoulder-launched, multipurpose recoilless weapon.
A Russian handheld anti-tank rocket launcher.
Soviet reusable rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) launcher.
84 mm recoilless rifle.
The missile uses a soft-launch system and is guided by predicted line of sight (PLOS).
The Type 98 (PF-98) is a 120mm unguided anti-tank rocket system.
WPMC Single Fire Grenade Launcher chambered in 40mm grenades. 14 Rounds
WPMC Single Fire Grenade Launcher chambered in 40mm grenades. 14 Rounds
A South African-designed multi-shot grenade launcher chambered for 40mm grenades. With a six-round rotating cylinder, it provides rapid indirect fire capability for military and special forces.
A South African-designed multi-shot grenade launcher chambered for 40mm grenades. With a six-round rotating cylinder, it provides rapid indirect fire capability for military and special forces.

An Improvised Explosive Device, typically crafted from available materials for asymmetric warfare. Used in guerrilla tactics and insurgency operations, it can range from crude roadside bombs to sophisticated remote-detonated explosives.
A flashbang
A flashbang

deployables.description: Slows down and damages enemies. Great for choke points slowing down enemy movement
Solid cover to protect from incoming fire
Provides a peronal concealed firing position
Provides access to elevated positions
Provides solid cover and is difficult to climb over. Lined with barbed wire.
Provides solid cover and is difficult to climb over. Lined with barbed wire.
